newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Colombia's Bavaria '96 net up 18.9 pct.
newsitem.headline: Colombia's Bavaria '96 net up 18.9 pct.

text.p: Colombian brewing giant Bavaria SA said its consolidated 1996 net profit rose by 18.9 percent over 1995 to 214.77 billion pesos.

The company, flagship of the Santo Domingo industrial group and one of Colombia's most actively traded stocks, said its earnings growth was partly fueled by a 16.9 percent rise in net sales to 772.1 billion pesos last year.

It also announced that it plans to hike its annual dividend by 37.2 percent, to 165.90 pesos per share, at a stockholders' meeting on March 21. The annual dividend is currently set at 120.90 pesos per share.
